text: Data Science student with experience in scalable data pipelines, predictive models, and big data analytics. Skilled in Python, SQL, and ETL, with strong foundations in data quality and machine learning.

school: Siebel School of Computing and Data Science

responsibilities: Built pipelines processing 25GB of F1 telemetry & weather data
Trained RandomForest & XGBoost models with data quality checks
Created data visualizations for feature importance
Designed predictive pipelines with ensemble learning
achievements: Secured 2nd place out of 25 teams in IDSC’s Data Dive Competition

responsibilities: Built end-to-end data solution combining financial forecasting and fraud risk analysis
Developed chain forecasting model with linear regression (RMSE 1200)
Engineered RandomForest classifier detecting fraud risk with 86% accuracy
achievements: Finalist out of 180 teams, recognized for technical maturity, business alignment, and data quality practices

title: NFL Injury Forecast
text: Developed web scraper for player injury data (2004–2022). Built linear regression model to predict retention after injuries with 60% accuracy. Used SQL to manipulate large datasets ensuring accuracy.

title: Candidate Recommendation Engine
text: Built AI-driven web app using SentenceTransformer embeddings to rank candidates (ROC AUC 0.81, Accuracy 71%). Added PDF resume parser grouping 50+ resumes. Integrated Google Gemini API to generate automated summaries, reducing manual review time by 40%. Streamlit UI allowed recruiters to filter, rank, and download reports.
